channel.title: Legal game?
channel.description: Ok guys, I've been working on a flash game for about 4 months now (I know it's much but while making it I learned to work with the as3 language as well). And it's not any noobish game a noob makes when wanting to make a game. It's pretty solid and I don't think people would tell it's made by someone who has never had any education in computers/flash whatsoever. And since I've been working on it for that long I've made plans for making money with it. Actully the money part is ready to go, the game is almost finished, doing some finishing touches, everything is perfect with the advertising company I'm working with (that's my money source, ads). BUT I've used some sounds of a counter strike gun replacement soundmod in my game downloaded from fpsbanana (a site for modding games) from some random guy. I wonder if that could get me in trouble? If they will maybe cut off my money or something like that. So this is a question to all of those who know some law and have made productions before. I'm 16 and this is my first attempt at earning online money.

item.title: Legal game?
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Aeolian, post:43, topic:391815”]Read my first post. I responded, just as you requested me to do so, and you blatantly ignored it. I do hope this thread is locked as you are incapable of reading an accurate and direct response.[/quote]Well maybe if you had said something useful, I would’ve responded to that. I didn’t ask you to tell me what platform to use for my game.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:36, topic:391815”]I honestly don’t understand how to play lol.[/quote]You are a fish, you need to eat other fish to get bigger, eat fish that are bigger than you = you dead.

To assist your fish you are able to use fire arms and also when you use those to kill other fish your fish will grow as well.

Goal, get the highest score.

item.dc:creator: @Mod_Whip Mod Whip
item.description:
@Mod_Whip wrote:

to use copyrighted content you need permission. there’s expections that fall under “fair use”, but if your earning money off of something I doubt pleading fair use in court will get you very far.
